alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 8:42PM MST until August 12 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND EAST CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 842 PM MST, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain earlier across parts of Northwest Maricopa and Eastern La Paz counties. Streamflow gauges on Jackrabbit Wash and Centennial Wash have reported significant runoff. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tonopah, Gladden, Aguila, Wenden, Salome, Harcuvar, Vicksburg Junction and Vicksburg. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 72 between mile markers 39 and 48. US Highway 60 between mile markers 40 and 49. AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 45 and 54. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Wash, Coyote Wash, Woodchopper Wash, Salome Wash, Star Wash, Pump Mine Wash, Centennial Wash, Beer Bottle Wash, Delaney Wash, Calcite Wash, Alamo Wash, Tiger Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Cunningham Wash, Powerline Wash, Browns Canyon Wash, Old Camp Wash, Bouse Wash, Grass Wash, Winters Wash, Jimmie Wash, Dead Horse Wash and Fourmile Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
